newsitem.title: USA: High Plains Wheat - Much-needed snows arrive.
newsitem.headline: High Plains Wheat - Much-needed snows arrive.

text.p: Much-needed snow fell overnight in Texas and Oklahoma, and more was expected to fall Thursday throughout Kansas and Oklahoma, grain dealers said.
"It's just started snowing and it's a real wet kind of snow," a merchandiser in Enid, Okla. said. "They say we could get up to five or six inches. That's good -- we need a lot of moisture."

Dealers in Kansas said six to eight inches of snow were likely to accumulate in the southwest part of the state. Some schools in Dodge City and other parts of southwest Kansas had already closed Thursday morning due to snow, dealers said.
Meanwhile, basis bids for hard red winter wheat were steady to lower Thursday at locations throughout the High Plains, grain dealers said.
Basis values in cents/bu against KCBT wheat, cash=dollars/bu.
(Note: H=KCBT March wheat futures. unq- unquoted, na - not applicable)
